goal.title: End poverty in all its forms everywhere

indicators.title: Proportion of population covered by social protection floors/systems, by sex, distinguishing children, unemployed persons, older persons, persons with disabilities, pregnant women, newborns, work-injury victims and the poor and the vulnerable

goal.title: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture

indicators.title: Prevalence of stunting (height for age <-2 standard deviation from the median of the World Health Organization (WHO) Child Growth Standards) among children under 5 years of age
Prevalence of malnutrition (weight for height >+2 or <-2 standard deviation from the median of the WHO Child Growth Standards) among children under 5 years of age, by type (wasting and overweight)

goal.title: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages

indicators.title: Proportion of births attended by skilled health personnel
Under‑5 mortality rate
Neonatal mortality rate
Proportion of women of reproductive age (aged 15–49 years) who have their need for family planning satisfied with modern methods
Adolescent birth rate (aged 10–14 years; aged 15–19 years) per 1,000 women in that age group
Coverage of essential health services
Age-standardized prevalence of current tobacco use among persons aged 15 years and older
Proportion of the target population covered by all vaccines included in their national programme

goal.title: Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all

indicators.title: Proportion of children and young people (a) in grades 2/3; (b) at the end of primary; and (c) at the end of lower secondary achieving at least a minimum proficiency level in (i) reading and (ii) mathematics, by sex
Proportion of children aged 24-59 months who are developmentally on track in health, learning and psychosocial well-being, by sexi
Participation rate in organized learning (one year before the official primary entry age), by sex
Proportion of youth and adults with information and communications technology (ICT) skills, by type of skill

Parity indices (female/male, rural/urban, bottom/top wealth quintile and others such as disability status, indigenous peoples and conflict-affected, as data become available) for all education indicators on this list that can be disaggregated

goal.title: Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls

indicators.title: Proportion of women aged 20–24 years who were married or in a union before age 15 and before age 18
Proportion of individuals who own a mobile telephone, by sex

goal.title: Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all

indicators.title: Proportion of population using safely managed drinking water services
Proportion of population using (a) safely managed sanitation services and (b) a hand-washing facility with soap and water

goal.title: Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all

indicators.title: Proportion of population with access to electricity
Proportion of population with primary reliance on clean fuels and technology

goal.title: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all

indicators.title: Proportion of youth (aged 15–24 years) not in education, employment or training

goal.title: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels

indicators.title: Proportion of children aged 1–17 years who experienced any physical punishment and/or psychological aggression by caregivers in the past month
Proportion of children under 5 years of age whose births have been registered with a civil authority, by age

goal.title: Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development

indicators.title: Proportion of individuals using the Internet
